item.title: Covid-19: Starmer calls for bigger pay rise for NHS 'heroes'
item.description: The Labour leader was responding to a government recommendation of a 1% increase for staff in England.

item.title: Covid: Asthma patients refused vaccine by some GPs
item.description: Some are not being prioritised if they haven't been to hospital recently for the condition.

item.title: Covid-19: Cyprus to welcome vaccinated UK tourists from May
item.description: It is not yet clear how visitors will be required to prove they have received both doses of a jab.

item.title: Covid contracts still unpublished despite Boris Johnson's claim
item.description: Days after the PM said all contracts were "on the record", government lawyers admitted many were not.

item.title: Covid 19: 'His mental health has suffered all along'
item.description: Michael, who has dementia, hasn't been able to properly see his family for a year, due to Covid-19 restrictions in his nursing home.

item.title: Covid-19: Starmer's NHS pay call and Cyprus to welcome vaccinated Brits
item.description: Five things you need to know about the coronavirus pandemic this Friday morning.

item.title: New Zealand earthquakes: Tsunami warnings lifted after evacuations
item.description: A series of earthquakes, one of 8.1 magnitude, trigger evacuation orders that are later stood down.

item.title: Covid: Italy 'blocks' AstraZeneca vaccine shipment to Australia
item.description: The bar on shipping 250,000 doses amid a row with the firm is backed by the EU.

item.title: Brexit: EU legal action imminent over UK extension to grace periods
item.description: The UK says it will unilaterally extend grace periods for Irish Sea border checks on parcels and agri-foods.

item.title: Government has no climate change plan - MPs
item.description: Two reports from MPs cast doubt on the government's approach to meeting its climate change goals.

item.title: Football racism: Premier League and EFL asked to help tackle problem
item.description: A senior officer wants the Premier League and EFL to act before fans return to stadiums.

item.title: Budget 2021: Four things missing from Rishi Sunak
item.description: Where was the help for the environment, social care, renters, and to cover the future costs of Covid?

item.title: The Papers: NHS pay 'insult' and EU vaccine 'volte-face'
item.description: A proposed 1% pay rise for NHS staff and the EU blocking the export of vaccines are among the lead stories.

item.title: Our Lives: Will my hometown survive this lockdown?
item.description: An ongoing Covid-19 study has shown how the North of England was hit harder than the rest of the country.

item.title: Rare black fox spotted in London garden
item.description: A rare black fox has been caught on camera prowling around a garden in west London.

item.title: Celebrating the world's largest female afro
item.description: Simone Williams sees her hair, which measures nearly 1.5m in circumference, as a symbol of pride.

item.title: Northern Pacific seastar: The sea intruder causing havoc in Tasmania
item.description: Locals hope removing an introduced starfish can help save an iconic Australian species.

item.title: Rare black fox spotted in London garden
item.description: The fox frequently visits the garden of Faroz and his daughter Sophia, who initially thought it was a wolf.

item.title: BTS named world's best-selling artists of 2020
item.description: The Korean boyband beat Taylor Swift and Drake to top the chart.

item.title: International Women's Day: Illustrating the Covid-19 pandemic
item.description: These three artists turn complex research into easy to digest information to help fight coronavirus.

item.title: Covid: Fresh air 'key to safer classrooms'
item.description: Knowing which windows to open and having shorter lessons could help when children return to school.

item.title: Towns Fund: How were the winners chosen?
item.description: There has been controversy about the 45 towns sharing just over £1bn from the Towns Fund.

item.title: Nalleli Cobo: How a nine-year-old fought an oil company and won
item.description: Nalleli Cobo started suffering from asthma, nosebleeds and headaches.

item.title: The Father: Why Olivia Colman's new film will leave you disoriented
item.description: The Father puts you in the confused head of a dementia sufferer, played by Sir Anthony Hopkins.

item.title: When is the census and what is it for?
item.description: The once-a-decade survey gives a snapshot of UK life and helps find out what services are needed.

item.title: Data experts are becoming football's best signings
item.description: A growing number of clubs big and small are using more technology to help performances on the pitch.

item.title: Team Sturgeon breathes a sigh of relief
item.description: Nicola Sturgeon's team believes no real punches were landed in eight hours of questioning by MSPs.

item.title: Why are QAnon believers obsessed with 4 March?
item.description: Believers are using an old, irrelevant law to herald the supposed return to power of Donald Trump.

item.title: Football Focus: David Moyes is setting his sights on sides above West Ham
item.description: West Ham manager David Moyes says he's "looking up" the Premier League table and trying to catch the teams above the Hammers, who are sixth after an impressive season so far.

item.title: 'The handball rule is crazy' - Parker wants law change after loss to Spurs
item.description: Fulham manager Scott Parker says the video assistant referee is "killing" the excitement in football.

item.title: New Zealand v England: Tourists wrap up series with six-wicket win
item.description: Freya Davies and Tammy Beaumont both impress as England beat New Zealand by six wickets in the second Twenty20 in Wellington to win the series.

item.title: Three-match ban rules Hastings out of Scotland v Italy in Six Nations
item.description: Adam Hastings will miss Scotland's Six Nations game against Italy and two Glasgow Warriors fixtures after his red card against Leinster.

item.title: Covid: When can I go on holiday in the UK or travel abroad?
item.description: The government has unveiled its plans for unlocking UK restrictions, including holiday travel.

item.title: Covid variants: What happens when a virus mutates?
item.description: New Covid-19 variants keep appearing – and their mutations are very different to the comic book kind.

item.title: Covid: What is the Oxford-AstraZeneca vaccine?
item.description: The Oxford University-AstraZeneca vaccines should save many lives, say experts.

item.title: Covid: What’s the problem with the EU vaccine rollout?
item.description: The coronavirus vaccine is being rolled out across the EU but there have been delays.

item.title: Lockdown Learning: What educational resources are on TV, iPlayer and online?
item.description: As schools remain closed to most pupils, the BBC is offering a wealth of educational material.
